intro: Eurotia ceratoides var. ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty thimblecush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a reddish or rust-colored appearance, giving it its common name. The plant thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
